question.body: Which of the following parts of the gall bladder is not correctly matched with its function?

multiple_choice.choice: Fundus -- projects inferiorly beyond the inferior border of the liver.
Body -- the central portion of the gall bladder.
Neck -- tapered portion of the superior part of the gall bladder.
Cystic Duct -- carries bile to the gall bladder from the liver.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The fundus is the wide part of the gall bladder that runs inferiorly past the inferior border of the liver.
Incorrect. The body is the central portion of the gall bladder that projects superiorly.
Incorrect. The neck is the tapered portion of the gall bladder that projects superiorly.
Correct. The cystic duct is the duct that drains bile from the gall bladder. It does not bring bile to the gall bladder from the liver
